content.description: The Underground Railroad traverses right, up the obvious seam. Start on the far left side of the boulder on a good jug, and traverse right on good incuts, spikes, and a few jugs.  The crux is at the top of the boulder. It is very committing and heady, you must really commit to the last few moves. This is a really great problem and a fantastic warm-up for the harder problems on the other side.
content.protection: The fall can be protected with one pad, though more than one is highly recommended. The landing is a bit on the sketchy side.
content.location:
It is on the back side of the Freedom Boulder (opposite of

The Amendment

,

Freedom

,

The Right

, etc.).

content.description:
Start sitting as for

The Amendment

, climb through

The Amendment

and continue along the steep arete feature via slopers, pinches, and crimps under the roof to a scary finish. Might be hard for the grade.
content.protection:
2-3 Mondo pads, +2 Drop Zones. That's if you have

The Amendment

wired, as you should! Pad the rock, watch your back!

content.description:
Start sitting as for

Freedom

, then head right out to finish

The Right

with technical kneebars. This is a different method from the FA of

The Right

.

In the cave of the Freedom Boulder is a poor crimp. Using this with the right hand, jump left for the lip. After some heelhooking, a somewhat sketchy finish up the slab, just left of the corner proper. A more direct finish exists going straight up the corner.

There has been debate about this problem's rating. I suspect if you are much shorter than 5'8", you are going to take the V10 rating.
content.protection: A few pads. The landing is uneven and rocky and the slabby section is awkward.

content.description:
The Amendment is just above Boulder Falls 50 feet from the waters edge and 75-100 yards from the falls.  The problem traverses into an existing boulder problem called

Freedom

.  Start on the left side of the boulder and traverse on bad slopers into

Freedom

.  Finish

Freedom

.

Freedom

is rated V10, with The Amendment being more difficult, so the V10/11 grade is given.  Maybe easier, may be harder than V10/11.
